Section.Paragraph: The work described here focuses on recognition of the Wall Street Journal (WSJ) pilot database \[17\], a new CSR database which supports 5K, 20K, and up to 64K- word CSR tasks. The original Lincoln Tied-Mixture HMM CSR was implemented using a time-synchronous beam-pruned search of a static network\[14\] and does not extend well to this task because the recognition network would be too large for currently practical workstations. Therefore, the recognizer has been converted to a stack decoder-based search strategy\[I,7,16\].

This decoder has been shown to function effectively on up to 64K-word recognition of continuous speech. This paper describes the acoustic modeling techniques and the implementation of the stack decoder used to obtain these results.
